page.title: 11Police station, Haltwhistle
page.content: There are 6 policemen and a sergeant stationed in Haltwhistle. With the help of one policeman in Allendale and one in Whitfield, they keep the Law in an area of about 700 square miles. A landrover is used to visit remote spots. Traffic police from Hexham patrol the busy A69 and "specials" are on call if extra help is needed. The most common crimes are driving offences, drunken behaviour and some petty stealing. Haltwhistle does not have a name as a lawless community, though last week children from the Middle School were handcuffed, finger printed and put in the cell. However this was a friendly visit and after trying on the sergeant's helmet and jacket, examining the contents of the patrol car and wakening up night shift workers with whistles and sirens, the police allowed them to return home.
